Are you a touring engineer? Perhaps a touring musician?
Or are you simply interested in knowing what the rules are for wireless microphones throughout the world?

MHz is the app for you.

When purchasing new wireless equipment, you have to take into account the shifting availability of frequencies. Digital TV and LTE bands are taking over much of the frequency areas, previously available to wireless mics.

With MHz you now have all the information in your pocket.
Simply swipe across the world, tap on the country's flag and presto; a full overview of the rules, regulations and (most importantly) frequencies, is at your fingertips.

We'll continue to add more countries to the list.

What about "White-space" frequencies, you say?
Well, MHz can also help you get the available frequencies, right where you are! By using your devices GPS, MHz can pinpoint your exact location and check online databases for available white-space frequencies, right where you are.

If that wasn't enough, there's also a search function, that lets you search for a specific location. That way, if your planning a tour, you can use MHz to plan ahead.

Denmark, Sweden, USA & Finland.

Other countries, where you can find rules, frequency bands etc. include:

- Easy to use, intuitive interface. Simple, single touch "Clock in/Clock Out" dial for on-the-go time tracking.
- Calendar section allows you to add your work shifts, with pop-up push reminders for when you work, as well as the ability to manually add timecards, and view all of the days you worked or have work scheduled. 
- Users:  Add unlimited users within the app, all with their own separate data. Protect each user data with a password lock.
- Reports page lets you export multiple Pay Periods, regardless of job, all in the same email with Text, CSV, and PDF export options.

- Main display shows money earned, clocked-in time, and how many hours you've worked.
- Use the menu button on the homepage, to quickly select the job/employee you need to clock into.

- Icon badge indicator shows how many jobs you're currently clocked into without having to open the app.

- Calculate both daily and weekly overtime hours at the same time.

- Manually add individual days that you’ve missed.
- Manually edit timecards to change clocked in/out times, add notes, etc...

Features include: 
- Record your incoming calls 
- Record your outgoing calls 
- Download and share recordings via Email, iMessage, Twitter, Facebook, and Dropbox 
- Playback controls to skip forward or backward
- Rate adjustment to change the playback speed

Steps for recording an incoming (existing) call: 
1) Open Call Recorder 
2) Go to the Record screen and tap the Record button 
3) Your existing call is put on hold and your phone will dial our recording number 
4) Once connected to our recording number, tap the Merge button on your screen to create a 3-way call between your existing call and our recording line 

Steps for recording an outgoing call: 
1) Open Call Recorder 
2) Go to the Record screen and tap the Record button 
3) Your phone will dial our recording number 
4) Once connected to our recording number, tap the Add call button on your screen to call your desired contact. 
5) Tap the Merge button to create a 3-way call between your existing call and our recording line 

This Pro version of Call Recorder comes with 300 minutes worth of credits.  More credits can be purchased within the app and bulk discounts are available.

Please note that 3-way calling is a required phone feature for Call Recorder to work properly. Cellular carriers known to NOT support 3-way calling are: H2O Wireless, Virgin Mobile
